summary: SKSE plugin for ObjectReference selected in Command Console
descriptionHtml:
This is a simple [color=#ffff00]modders resource[/color] that allows programmatic [color=#ffff00]access to objects selected via[/color] mouse clicks in the [color=#ffff00]command console[/color].

It is a custom SKSE plugin, created with the guidance of PurpleLunchBox.
It is my understanding that this function will be added to the next release of SKSE, so this is an interim solution that will be retired in the future.
[b]Now implemented in SKSE 1.7.2 beta[/b]

Example code:
[font=Courier New]Debug.Notification ("Click on an object to select and tap ~")
;open the console
Input.TapKey(Input.GetMappedKey("Console"))
;wait for console to close
Utility.Wait(0.1)
[color=#00ff00]ObjectReferenceÂ objSelected = JaxonzConsolePlugIn.GetCurrentConsoleRef()[/color]
[/font]

[b] [color=#ffff00]Added INI file value reading functions.[/color][/b]
These are distinct from SKSE Utility script functions which can only read Bethesda-defined INI values. They allow custom INI values in your own mod INI file.
Not that for safety, these functions do not allow write access.
See the included Example project and source code for usage. JaxonzConsolePluging.PSC also has annotated syntax.[/color][/font]
author: Jaxonz

files.name: Jaxonz Console PlugIn
files.changelogHtml: Same files reposted as loose file archive. It was determined that the SKSE DLL packaged within a BSA would not work without extraction.

files.name: Jaxonz Console PlugIn
files.changelogHtml:
Recompiled SKSE plugin DLL as Release so that it should work on all systems
Loose file packaging

files.name: Jaxonz Console Plugin
files.changelogHtml: Added functions to read values from private INI files.
